name: The Bus to Kaltvik
text: The engine drones, a low vibration that rattles your teeth. Outside, the tundra is a blur of grey and white. You are the only passenger left. The driver, a man with a neck like a tree stump, watches you in the mirror. Kaltvik is ten minutes out.

variants.believer: The vibration feels like a frequency. Tuning your mind to the town's resonance.
variants.skeptic: Just an old engine and a poorly maintained road. Nothing more.
variants.haunted: He's watching you. He knows why you're here. They all know.

choices.text: Ask the driver about the town.

name: Your Notes
text: Your notebook is a chaotic mess of clippings and scribbles. '347 People.' 'The Aurora Anomalies.' 'Project TYGER.' You've come a long way for answers.

passive_clues.reveal_text: You notice a date circled in red: 'October 12th, 1984'. The day the static started.

name: The Tundra
text: Endless snow. Twisted trees that look like grasping hands. The sky is a bruised purple, even at midday.

variants.haunted: The trees aren't just twisted. They're reaching for the road. For you.

name: Driver's Gossip
text: "Kaltvik? Not many folks go there on purpose these days. Not since the 'incidents'. But the lights... they're beautiful. If you don't look at them too long."

name: Driver's Silence
text: He grunts and turns the radio up. Static fills the bus. He clearly doesn't want to talk.

name: Kaltvik Bus Stop
text: The bus hisses to a halt. You step off into the biting cold. The bus pulls away immediately, leaving you in a cloud of exhaust. The town of Kaltvik lies ahead. A collection of wooden buildings huddled against the cold.

name: Aurora Hotel Lobby
text: The lobby is warm, smelling of pine and old dust. A clock ticks loudly. The receptionist is an elderly woman who seems to be knitting nothing.

name: Check In
text: "Room 204. Top floor. Don't mind the pipes," she says, handing you a heavy brass key. "And stay in after dark. The wind plays tricks."

choices.text: Take the key and go to your room.

add_item.name: Room 204 Key
add_item.description: A heavy brass key with a faded tag.

name: Room 204
text: A simple room with a single bed and a window overlooking the mountains. The radiator hisses.

variants.haunted: The shadows in the corner are too deep. The radiator sounds like breathing.

name: Unpacking
text: You lay out your gear. Tape recorder, camera, notebook. Tools of the trade. You are ready.

name: View from Room 204
text: You see the town below. A few people walking with heads down. Beyond, the forest line stands like a wall.

name: Town Square
text: The center of Kaltvik. A statue of a miner stands in the middle, covered in frost. To the north, the Diner. To the east, the path to the woods.

name: The Last Stop Diner
text: Fluorescent lights buzz. The smell of frying grease and coffee. A few locals sit at the counter.

name: Diner Counter
text: A waitress pours you coffee without asking. "You're the new one. The writer? Or the detective?"

name: Cover Story
text: "Writer, huh? Plenty of stories here. Most of them end badly." She walks away.

name: The Truth
text: She freezes. "We don't need more people poking around. Leave it alone." She slams the pot down.

name: Edge of the Woods
text: The tree line is dense. A sign reads: 'DANGER: UNSTABLE GROUND'. Footprints lead into the darkness.

name: The Clearing
text: You find a clearing. In the center, the snow is melted in a perfect circle. The ground is warm to the touch. The air hums.

variants.believer: It's a landing site. Or a portal. The energy is palpable.
variants.haunted: The heat reminds you of the fire. The smell of burning...

passive_clues.reveal_text: You notice the melted snow hasn't turned to water. It's... sublimated. Gone.

add_evidence.name: Warm Soil Sample
add_evidence.description: Soil from the anomaly. It remains warm.

name: The Shadows Move
text: You step closer to the tree line. The darkness seems to detach itself from the trees. It forms a shape. A silhouette made of void.

name: Taking a Sample
text: You scoop the soil into a jar. It vibrates slightly in your hand.

name: The Shift
text:
Suddenly, the sky turns a violent shade of green. The hum becomes a roar. You fall to your knees as reality seems to bend around you. A voice speaks, not from outside, but from within your own skull.

"WE SEE YOU."

name: Waking Up... Again?
text: You wake up in the same bed in the Aurora Hotel. But the clock is running backwards. And the door... the door is gone.

name: To Be Continued
text: Thank you for playing the Vertical Slice of Tyger Tyger.
